metadata.Title: CVE-2014-9297 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
** REJECT **  DO NOT USE THIS CANDIDATE NUMBER.  ConsultIDs: CVE-2014-9750, CVE-2014-9751.  Reason: this ID was intended for one issue, but was associated with two issues.  Notes: All CVE users should consult CVE-2014-9750 and CVE-2014-9751 to identify the ID or IDs of interest. All references and descriptions in this candidate have been removed to prevent accidental usage.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-9297` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

ntp - 1:4.2.6.p5+dfsg-3ubuntu2.14.04.2
ntpdate - 1:4.2.6.p5+dfsg-3ubuntu2.14.04.2
No subscription required

advisory.DiscoveredBy: Stephen Roettger, Sebastian Krahmer, Harlan Stenn

notes.Note: mdeslaur> Debian's patch in 1:4.2.6.p5+dfsg-4 seems to be missing the first commit.

criterions.comment: ntp package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:4.2.6.p5+dfsg-3ubuntu2.14.04.2').
